page.title: 03QUERNMORE'S SHEEPDOG HANDLER
page.content: Mr.Tim Longton first started going to sheepdog trials in 1947,and he has been going ever since. He finds it difficult to choose which is his favourite dog,but he thinks it might be Ken who won the Supreme International Champion Shield. At the moment he has got one bitch and four dogs.He breeds and sells the dogs.A working dog costs 400 to 500 pounds.The untrained puppies cost only 50 pounds.There has been a change in the price over the years because of inflation. His favourite award of all the ones he has had is the Supreme International Champion Shield.One of the cups he has won for three years in a row and for five years altogether.He has had lots of cups but he cannot remember how many he has won.
